item.description:
Join us as we begin the new year by viewing a film that is not only about what happened a few miles up the road from us, but a film that is also about our own agency in creating the type of human landscape we want to live in.

"In small towns and urban neighborhoods throughout America, chain-store commerce is transforming
landscapes and changing how we live. Under attack are our sense of belonging to a unique and
durable community, the health of the natural environment, and the jobs that provide decent
livelihoods. OURTOWN follows the story of two young mothers-turned-activists who challenged the
largest corporate retailer in the world, and won. This is a film about empowerment and hands-on
democracy; ultimately, it asks the questions: Who is in charge? Who gets to choose? What kind of
town do you want to live in?"

Trailer: http://www.ourtownmai...

The film makers from Red Door Media will be joining us for a discussion period after the film.

6:30 Potluck - an integral part of our meetings!
7:00 or so - introductions and start the film (55 minutes)
Discussion with Wrap up between 8:30 and 8:45
